title: Process Data in Bulk with Custom Transformer Parallel Processing

questions.question: Which of the following scenarios could benefit the most from parallel processing?
options: Your custom transformer conducts a geometry validation process on hundreds of road features split into thousands of groups by municipality.
Your custom transformer conducts a logical test on 3D bridge data split into many groups by bridge. The outcome of each tests affects the next test.
Your custom transformer conducts a small attribute edit to a small number (<10) customer features split into thousands of groups by company.
Your custom transformer conducts complex spatial analysis on thousands of geometry features split into three groups by county.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of processes possible while using FME Base Edition?
You must publish both a Group By parameter in your custom transformer to enable parallel processing.

The optimum number of groups to use when creating artificial groups for parallel processing should match the maximum number of processes allowable considering your hardware and license, assuming your workspace can process that many groups at once.
